fields.headline: Live music booking now
fields.bodyText: Art rockers Deerhoof are preparing for a brief two-date jaunt in the UK this December (3-4 Dec, tour begins Brudenell Social Club, Leeds). They'll be playing tracks off their recent Breakup Song album which has won them even more hype … On the subject of hype, one of the most talked-about bands of the year, Savages, have announced another London date for 2013 (21 Feb, Electric Ballroom, NW1) to follow their shows around Europe in November … Fresh from making Jools Holland's voice fluctuate even more dramatically than usual, Jessie Ware has announced a seven-date tour for March (6–13 Mar, tour begins Cambridge Junction). Catch her at mid-sized venues while you can … Wild Beasts have been quiet recently but the warbling indie darlings will be making noise again soon as they head back out on the road (5–9 Dec, tour begins Sage, Gateshead) … Finally, electronica marvels Walls will be playing their last (2 Nov, The Waiting Room, N16) in a brief DJ residency following sets from synth-building maverick Gavin Russom and Junior Boys, their guests are La Roux's mate Fort Romeau and The Field.
